intro: Telephium oligospermum, commonly known as the narrowleaf pussytoes, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in heads. It is often found in the eastern and central regions of the United States.
